intro: Scaevola lasiantha, commonly known as the pretty face flower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its striking, bilaterally symmetrical blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Scaevola lasiantha thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
